pullRequest.body:
Adds new syntax for sum/product big operators for `âˆ‘ x âˆˆ s, f x`. The set `s` can either be a `Finset` or a `Set` with a `Fintype` instance, in which case it is equivalent to `âˆ‘ x âˆˆ s.toFinset, f x`.

Also supports `âˆ‘ (x âˆˆ s) (y âˆˆ t), f x y` for `Finset.sum (s Ã—Ë¢ t) (fun âŸ¨x, yâŸ© â†¦ f x y)`. Note that these are not dependent products at the moment.

Adds `with` clauses, so for example `âˆ‘ (x âˆˆ Finset.range 5) (y âˆˆ Finset.range 5) with x < y, x * y`, which inserts a `Finset.filter` over the domain set.

Supports pattern matching in the variable position. This is by creating an experimental version of `extBinder` that uses `term:max` instead of `binderIdent`.

The new `âˆ‘ x âˆˆ s, f x` notation is used in `Algebra.BigOperators.Basic` for illustration, but the old `âˆ‘ x in s, f x` still works for backwards compatibility.


Zulip threads [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/.E2.88.91.20x.20.E2.88.88.20s.2C.20f.20x.20instead.20of.20.E2.88.91.20x.20in.20s.2C.20f.20x/near/387352818) and [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Destruction.20and.20big.20operators/near/387366894)

---

nodes.body: What I really care about is the `\sum ... with ..., ...` notation. If that makes it easier to get in, would you mind opening a PR with just this change. Then I can copy it in LeanAPAP, check it works there, and subsequently send your PR on the merge queue.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
Yes, we are still the old elaborators here: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/6795/files#diff-daef0dcb628557383518bbc8aaabe4b289271a26e17ffd78ab3c1aae7ba1d3b2R201-R215

> @eric-wieser still had some reservations that he was planning to share (and I do worry a bit about the "can I rewrite the `_ âˆˆ _`?"), so please do. Otherwise I'll merge this in a few days.

I've shared these in [the original zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/.E2.88.91.20x.20.E2.88.88.20s.2C.20f.20x.20instead.20of.20.E2.88.91.20x.20in.20s.2C.20f.20x/near/430039359).

Ah, thanks for the link. 
I think we should merge this. The notation is a lot nicer, and it shouldn't be too bad for users to adapt to this. 

bors d+
bors d=YaelDillies

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8896510639/job/24429288046)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8896510639/job/24429288453)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8896510639/job/24429288984)

I think this is great overall and deserves to be merged even if a few details still need ironing out. We need to try out the new syntaxes to eg decide what the correct behavior for nested sums is (I think the one in this PR is already correct, but who knows).

maintainer merge

I really want this notation to land. I am using it all over the place in LeanAPAP. The elaborator isn't perfect yet (no dependent products, unspecified interaction between nested and filtered products...) but it would already be a great step forward.

I think this is great overall and deserves to be merged even if a few details still need ironing out. We need to try out the new syntaxes to eg decide what the correct behavior for nested sums is (I think the one in this PR is already correct, but who knows).

maintainer merge
The changes to the `extBinder` syntax are in https://github.com/leanprover/std4/pull/234/files and in the meantime it's given as new syntax as `bigOpBinder` here.
Is it a valid alternative to elaborate this into a nested sum? That would automatically handle the case of `t` depending on `x`, right?

The thought was that if you wanted a nested sum then `âˆ‘ (x âˆˆ s), âˆ‘ (y âˆˆ t), f x y` is available. YaÃ«l and Bhavik were telling me about how this sort of behavior is helpful for related notations such as for expectation, so it might be worth being consistent here.

A downside though is that this PR is not supporting dependent products, i.e., you can't do `âˆ‘ (x âˆˆ s) (y âˆˆ t x), f x y`, and it's not very clear to me how to support them in a low-confusion way.
Shouldn't this be moved to an earlier file?

```suggestion
/-- Delaborator for `Finset.sum`. The `pp.piBinderTypes` option controls whether
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `âˆ‘ x âˆˆ s, f x` to replace `âˆ‘ x in s, f x` in the future

source.title: feat: change `extBinder` syntax to allow destructuring

nodes.body: I really want this notation to land. I am using it all over the place in LeanAPAP. The elaborator isn't perfect yet (no dependent products, unspecified interaction between nested and filtered products...) but it would already be a great step forward.

What I really care about is the `\sum ... with ..., ...` notation. If that makes it easier to get in, would you mind opening a PR with just this change. Then I can copy it in LeanAPAP, check it works there, and subsequently send your PR on the merge queue.

source.title: feat: `âˆ‘ hi : i âˆˆ s, f i hi` syntax for big operators
